excerpt: Sacred monument in honour of a Hindu monk built on a rock half a kilometre out to sea.
detail_description: Vivekananda Rock Memorial is a sacred monument dedicated to Hindu monk Swami Vivekananda, located on a rock in the sea. It is believed that Swami Vivekananda attained enlightenment after meditating on this rock. The site also holds significance as the place where Goddess Parvati did penance for Lord Shiva.
name: Vivekananda Rock Memorial

excerpt: Monumental, 40m-high statue and pedestal, of eminent Tamil poet and philosopher, on a small island.
detail_description: The Thiruvalluvar Statue is a monumental 40-meter-high statue and pedestal located on a small island near the Vivekananda Rock Memorial in Kanyakumari. It is dedicated to the eminent Tamil poet and philosopher, Saint Thiruvalluvar, who composed 1330 profound seven-worded couplets known as Thirukkural. This work emphasizes virtues such as duty, kindness, wealth, charity, gratitude, and love for all classes of people in society.
name: Thiruvalluvar Statue

excerpt: Sandy beach at the southern tip of the Indian Peninsula known for sunsets & moonrises over 3 seas.
detail_description: Kanyakumari Beach, situated at the southernmost tip of the Indian Peninsula, offers breathtaking views of sunsets and moonrises over the confluence of three seas: the Indian Ocean, Bay of Bengal, and Arabian Sea. The rocky shoreline provides a picturesque setting for leisurely strolls while listening to the unique sound of waves. Visitors can savor local cuisine and explore nearby temples. It is best to visit during December and January to avoid extreme heat and humidity.
name: Kanyakumari Beach

excerpt: Catholic church built in the Gothic Revival architectural style with a pearl-white exterior.
detail_description: Our Lady of Ransom Shrine, also known as Lady of Ransom Church, is a stunning Catholic church located in Kanyakumari. The Gothic Revival architectural style of the pearl-white exterior makes it a captivating sight for visitors. The church features simple stained glasswork on its doors and windows, a gold altar adorned with a statue of Mother Mary, intricately carved idols of Christ, disciples, and soldiers.
name: Our Lady of Ransom Shrine
address: Church Rd, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India

excerpt: Ornate temple & pilgrimage site, dating back thousands of years, dedicated to Hindu goddess Kumari.
detail_description: Sri Kanniyakumari Amman Temple is an ancient and ornate Hindu temple dedicated to the goddess Kumari. It is a significant pilgrimage site in Kanyakumari, offering visitors a spiritual experience amidst its Dravidian-style architecture and colorful ornamental pillars. The temple is famous for the dazzling diamond nose ring adorning the deity, which has been said to lead sailors astray due to its brightness.
name: Arulmigu Devi Kanniyakumari Baghavathi Amman Temple
address: 3HH2+P9H, Temple Rd, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India

excerpt: Pink memorial building with sea views on site where Gandhi's ashes were held after his death.
detail_description: Mahatma Gandhi Mandapam is a prominent pink memorial building located in Kanyakumari, offering stunning views of the sea. It was built to honor Mahatma Gandhi and stands at the site where one of the 12 urns containing his ashes was kept for public homage after his passing. The memorial also features a collection of photographs showcasing Mahatma Gandhi's life and legacy.
name: Mahatma Gandhi Mandapam

detail_description: Located in Kanniyakumari, the Gandhi Memorial, also known as Gandhi Mandapam, is a significant historical and cultural site. Constructed in 1956 to commemorate the immersion of Mahatma Gandhi's ashes into the sea, it draws inspiration from Odisha architecture. The memorial's design allows sunlight to illuminate the area where Gandhi's ashes were placed on his birthday.
name: Gandhi Memorial
address: 876, Barkview Bazar, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India

detail_description: Gandhi Mandapam, located in Kanyakumari, is a significant memorial dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi. Situated close to the shore, it marks the exact spot where his ashes were placed for public tribute before being dissolved in the Triveni Sangam. The memorial houses rare photographs of Gandhi with prominent Western figures and is a top tourist attraction in Kanyakumari.
name: Gandhi Mandapam
address: opposite Kanyakumari, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India

excerpt: Helical pedestrian ramp perched above the water, with views of the rocky coastline & ocean sunsets.
detail_description: The View Tower in Kanyakumari offers a stunning panoramic view of the coastal area, with its helical pedestrian ramp providing an elevated vantage point above the water. Situated near the Kumari Amman temple, Vivekananda Rock Memorial, and Thiruvalluvar statue, this five-storey circular tower is equipped with telescopes for observing these attractions as well as the sea.
name: View Tower | Kanniyakumari
address: Beach Rd, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India

excerpt: This intersection of the Ganges & Yamuna rivers is a Hindu pilgrimage site & sacred bathing place.
detail_description: Triveni Sangamam, located in Kanyakumari, is a significant Hindu pilgrimage site where the Ganges and Yamuna rivers intersect. This place holds great cultural and historical importance, having been ruled by various dynasties for thousands of years. The confluence of the Indian Ocean, Bay of Bengal, and Arabian Sea at Triveni Sangam offers a breathtaking view of the sunset and is considered holy by deities visiting the Kanyakumari temple.
name: Triveni Sangamam

excerpt: Small park honoring the victims of a 2004 tsunami with a monument surrounded by tranquil landscape.
detail_description: Tsunami Memorial Park in Kanyakumari is a small yet significant park dedicated to the victims of the devastating 2004 tsunami. Situated at the meeting point of three seas, it features a solemn monument set amidst serene surroundings. Despite its unassuming size, the park holds great emotional weight as it commemorates the lives lost during this tragic event.
name: Tsunami Memorial Park

excerpt: Funky museum within the Baywatch water park featuring lifelike wax figures & 3D paintings.
detail_description: Mayapuri Wonder Wax is a unique museum located within the Baywatch water park, offering an enjoyable indoor activity for individuals and families. The museum showcases lifelike wax figures of both Indian and international celebrities, including Albert Einstein, Charlie Chaplin, Rabindranath Tagore, Michael Jackson, and Mother Teresa. Additionally, visitors can admire a variety of interesting three-dimensional paintings within the museum.
name: Mayapuri Wonder Wax
address: Cape Rd, near Railway Station, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India

excerpt: Statues & sculptures are on display at this museum, as well as coins, wood carvings & whale bones.
detail_description: The Government Museum in Kanyakumari, Tamil Nadu, is a treasure trove of historical artifacts and cultural exhibits. Established in 1991, the museum showcases an extensive collection of coins, wood carvings, tribal objects, bronze sculptures, and crafts related to South Indian temples. Visitors can also explore zoological and botanical specimens including whale bones from Manavalakurichi town.
name: Government Museum, Kanniyakumari
address: 3HH2+X28, Beach Rd, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India

detail_description: Sunrise Point, located in Kanyakumari, is a popular spot that offers a vibrant and colorful view of the surroundings. The area is bustling with tourists, locals, pilgrims, and vendors from all walks of life. From this viewpoint, visitors can witness the breathtaking sight of Swami Vivekananda's statue against the backdrop of the sun rising over the sea. Kanyakumari itself is renowned for its stunning sunrises and sunsets, particularly on full moon days.
name: Sunrise Point
address: 3HJ2+XWV, Vavaturai Beach Rd, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu, India

detail_description: Sunset View Point in Kanyakumari is renowned for offering one of the most captivating sunset views in the world. Situated at the confluence of three water bodies, it provides a serene and tranquil atmosphere that attracts photographers and tourists from across the globe. The dedicated spot allows visitors to sit and enjoy the breathtaking sight of the sun melting into the horizon. Despite being free, this clean and spacious location can accommodate large crowds, making it an ideal place to witness nature's stunning spectacle.
name: Sunset View Point
address: Beach Rd, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India

excerpt: Popular destination for sunset views from a scenic point overlooking the ocean & rocky beach.
detail_description: Sunset Point, Kanyakumari is a renowned vantage point at the southernmost tip of India, offering stunning views of the sun setting over the meeting point of the Arabian Sea, Bay of Bengal, and Indian Ocean. Visitors flock to this spot for its mesmerizing sunsets and picturesque scenery. The clean beach provides an ideal setting for a leisurely stroll while witnessing the breathtaking sunset.
name: Sunset Point, Kanyakumari
Eco park
address: near, Pazhathoddam Eco park, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India

excerpt: Popular locale for watching the sunset featuring a rocky shoreline with park benches above.
detail_description: The Hidden Twin beach, situated near the Bhagavathy Amman Temple and close to Kanyakumari bus station, is a popular destination for watching sunsets. This picturesque locale boasts a rocky shoreline adorned with park benches above. It attracts visitors who come to admire its natural landscape while visiting the Vivekanand Rock memorial. Unlike many other beaches in India, it offers facilities for sitting and enjoying the serene beauty of nature.
name: The Hidden Twin beach

detail_description: The ARULMIGU BAGAVATHI AMMAN TEMPLE, estimated to be over 2500 years old, is dedicated to the worship of the girl child form of Hindu goddess Parvati. Visitors are captivated by the sparkling ruby nose-ring adorning the idol upon entering. The temple strictly adheres to a dress code, adding to its sacred ambiance and ensuring a respectful visit for all.
name: ARULMIGU BAGAVATHI AMMAN TEMPLE
address: 3HH2+X9F, Sannathi St, Panchalingapuram, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India

detail_description: Shri Bhagavathi Amman Temple Car With Shed, also known as Devi Kanya Kumari Temple, is a sacred site dedicated to the adolescent girl avatar of Goddess Parvati. It is believed to be the first stop on a private car day trip. The temple has strict timings and visitors can witness the mangalaarathi ceremony at night around 8:00 pm.
name: Shri Bhagavathi Amman Temple Car With Shed
address: 3HM2+5C8, E Car St, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India

excerpt: Compact seaside fort constructed in the 18th century & offering sweeping beach views.
detail_description: Vattakottai Fort, also known as the 'Circular Fort', is a well-preserved 18th-century seaside fort located near Kanyakumari, India's southernmost tip. Constructed mainly from granite blocks, the fort extends into the sea and offers sweeping beach views. The site features lush green lawns and well-maintained structures, making it an ideal spot for a leisurely evening walk or family outing.
name: Vattakottai Fort

excerpt: Family-friendly park with kids' water slides, wave pools & rides like trains & bumper cars.
detail_description: Baywatch Park in Kanyakumari is a fantastic destination for families, offering an array of thrilling rides and attractions suitable for all ages. The park features kids' water slides, wave pools, and various exciting rides such as trains and bumper cars. Visitors can expect a fun-filled day with plenty of opportunities for relaxation and rejuvenation. Additionally, the park provides excellent facilities including green rooms, bathrooms, dress stores, and dining options.
name: Baywatch theme Park
address: Kovalam Rd, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India

detail_description: Kanyakumari Sunrise View is a must-see attraction located at the southernmost tip of India, where you can witness breathtaking sunrises over the sea. Adjacent to the sunset view point, this spot offers equally spectacular views and is less crowded during the early morning hours. Situated near the Amman Temple, it attracts morning walkers, pilgrims, vendors and tourists.
name: Kanniyakumari Sunrise View

detail_description: Kanyakumari Shri Tirupathi Temple is a moderately big and well-maintained temple that offers a peaceful spot to pay respects to Lord Venkateswarar. The temple is not crowded, and there's no entry fee required. Visitors can capture stunning photos of the shrine, especially in broad daylight when the roof appears golden.
name: Kanniyakumari Shri Tirupathi Temple
address: 3HR6+P25, Chinnamuttom Harbour Rd, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India

excerpt: Popular pier made from large stones, offering picturesque ocean & sunrise vistas.
detail_description: Kanyakumari Pier is a popular tourist spot made from large stones, extending almost 500 meters into the sea. It offers stunning views of the ocean and is particularly known for its picturesque sunrise vistas. This man-made extension provides visitors with a unique opportunity to enjoy the beauty of Kanyakumari and observe sweeping sea views. While there is no entry fee, it's important to be cautious while walking on the pier due to gaps between the rocks.
name: Kanyakumari Pier

detail_description: Shady Grove in Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu is a peaceful retreat ideal for those who appreciate the beauty of nature and enjoy exploring. It offers a serene and tranquil environment, making it a perfect destination for nature lovers seeking a peaceful escape.
name: Shady Grove

detail_description: Vivekananda Kendra Beach, located in Vivekanandapuram, Kanyakumari, is a popular spot for tourists to witness stunning sunrises and sunsets over the Bay of Bengal. Visitors can explore the beach's clean and serene surroundings while also enjoying views of the Vivekananda Rock Memorial. The area is known for its cleanliness and offers opportunities to purchase sea shell crafts from local vendors.
name: Vivekananda Kendra Beach, Vivekanandapuram

detail_description: Kanyakumari, located at the southern tip of India, boasts stunning beaches and viewpoints offering spectacular sunrise and sunset views. While not the cleanest or most decorated beach, it still attracts tourists due to its natural beauty. The area is known as the last point of India geographically and offers a great vantage point for witnessing the sunrise. However, it can get crowded during peak times like Pongal in January.
name: Beach
Sea Shore Food Court
address: Beach Rd, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India

detail_description: Temple Rd is a captivating destination that draws visitors from all walks of life, eager to experience the spiritual ambiance of the ancient temple dedicated to Goddess Parvati. This sacred site, also known as Bhagavathy Amman Temple, is one of the revered 108 Shakti Peethas in Hindu mythology and holds a significant place in local culture. Nestled by the ocean's edge, its stunning architecture showcases intricate carvings and vibrant colors that reflect the rich heritage of the region.
name: Temple Rd

detail_description: Sunrise Clear View is a stunning spot located in Kanyakumari, at the southernmost tip of India where two seas and an ocean meet. This unique location allows visitors to witness both sunrise and sunset over the sea. Adjacent to the sunset view point, Sunrise Clear View offers an equally breathtaking experience with its incredibly beautiful sunrises. It's a perfect place for capturing the first light of day in this picturesque setting.
name: Sunrise clear view
address: 12/187, Vadakku Theru, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India

detail_description: Vavathurai Beach is a stunning and serene location near Sunrise Point, offering breathtaking views of the sunrise. However, visitors should prioritize safety due to potential risks, especially for children. The beach is less crowded than other areas and provides a peaceful atmosphere for enjoying the sunrise. While it may be beautiful in the morning, it can become busy with fishing boats and vendors in the afternoon. Additionally, visitors should be cautious of hidden rocks and litter along the shore.
name: Vavathurai Beach

excerpt: Grand palace with a carved rose wood interior, an imposing main king's chamber and a granite hall.
detail_description: Padmanabhapuram Palace, located in Thuckalay near Kanyakumari, is a grand complex showcasing the finest traditional Keralan architecture. Built in the 16th century by the Travancore dynasty's Ravipillai Perumal, it boasts intricately carved rosewood ceilings and polished-teak beams.
name: Padmanabhapuram Palace

excerpt: Elevated concrete aqueduct & walkway offering a broad view of the river below & surrounding valley.
detail_description: Mathoor Aqueduct, also known as the Mathoor Hanging Trough, is a remarkable elevated concrete bridge built by Kamaraj for carrying water across the landscape. The aqueduct offers a stunning 1.5-kilometer walkway with breathtaking views of the surrounding valley and river below. Visitors can enjoy a sense of adventure while marveling at the natural water flow over rocks and even take a dip in the river.
name: Mathoor Aqueduct

excerpt: Beach retreat offering shallow swimming waters, picnic spots & an observation tower.
detail_description: Chothavilai Beach, also known as Sothavilai Beach, is a top destination in Kanyakumari, located about 10 km from the city. With its 4km stretch of sandy shoreline, it's one of the longest beaches in Tamil Nadu. The beach offers shallow swimming waters and high sand dunes, making it a picturesque spot for beach lovers.
name: Chothavilai Beach

excerpt: A large, white conch sculpture dating from the King Cholaera is found on this long sandy beach.
detail_description: Sanguthurai Beach, located in the southernmost part of India, is a serene and pristine beach with long stretches of white sand. It features a large, ancient conch sculpture from the King Chola-era and offers a tranquil atmosphere for visitors to enjoy sunrise and sunset. The beach is relatively unspoiled and isolated, making it an ideal destination for those seeking peace and quiet.
name: Sanguthurai Beach

detail_description: The Mahavirswami Jain Temple Dadawadi in Kanyakumari is an ideal location for Jain and Gujarati people seeking a peaceful retreat. Situated near the sunset point, the temple offers sea-facing rooms that are clean and affordable. The temple also has facilities for Jain food and a nearby Gujarat Bhavan for families. Accessible by auto at any time, it is close to the beach, Triveni Sangam and other palaces of interest.
name: Shri Mahaveerswami Jain Mandir Dadawadi, Kanyakumari
address: West Kovalam Road, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India

detail_description: Thengapattanam Beach, situated in Kanyakumari district, is a serene and unspoiled gem that offers a perfect setting for a peaceful retreat. The beach boasts lush coconut groves, tranquil surroundings, and a clean shoreline with gentle waves. It's an ideal spot for nature enthusiasts and photographers seeking picturesque views. Visitors can also witness the traditional coastal lifestyle as local fishermen operate in the area.
name: Thengapattanam Beach
Lemurian Park
address: Beach Rd, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India

detail_description: Tamil Annai Park is a charming urban park located in the heart of the city. It offers lush greenery, well-maintained walking paths, and beautiful floral displays. The park provides a peaceful escape from the hustle and bustle of city life, making it a popular spot for locals and tourists alike to relax and unwind. With its serene atmosphere and scenic surroundings, Tamil Annai Park is an ideal place for leisurely strolls, picnics, or simply enjoying nature's beauty.
name: Tamil Annai Park
address: Beach Rd, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India
